trans-unit.source: Provides a managed wrapper around a High Level Shading Language (HLSL) pixel shader.
Use the PixelShader class to access pre-compiled HLSL bytecode in a Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) application.
You can create a PixelShader from a Pack URI reference or from a <xref:System.IO.Stream>.
Set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Effects.PixelShader.UriSource%2A> property or call the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Effects.PixelShader.SetStreamSource%2A> method to load the shader bytecode.
To create a custom effect, assign the PixelShader to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Effects.ShaderEffect.PixelShader%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Effects.ShaderEffect>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Effects.PixelShader"></xref> class.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Effects.PixelShader"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying this object's dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (which may no longer resolve), but not animations or their current values.
The Clone method can be used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects.
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A> method to provide a strongly typed implementation.
A modifiable clone of this instance.
The returned clone is effectively a deep copy of the current object.
The clone's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Effects.PixelShader"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are copied.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
Occurs when the render thread cannot process the pixel shader.
To be added.
Assigns the <xref:System.IO.Stream> to use as the source of HLSL bytecode.
The stream to read the HLSL bytecode from.
source is .
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use hardware or software rendering.
By default, a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Effects.ShaderEffect> renders in hardware when there is a capable hardware accelerator; otherwise, it renders in software.
The ShaderRenderMode property alters this behavior, based on its value.
If set to <xref:System.Windows.Media.Effects.ShaderRenderMode>, and there is no capable hardware available, the entire <xref:System.Windows.Media.Effects.ShaderEffect> is ignored.
If set to <xref:System.Windows.Media.Effects.ShaderRenderMode>, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Effects.ShaderEffect> always renders using software rendering.
If set to <xref:System.Windows.Media.Effects.ShaderRenderMode>, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Effects.ShaderEffect> has the default behavior.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Effects.ShaderRenderMode"></xref> value that indicates whether to force the use of hardware or software rendering for the effect.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Effects.PixelShader.ShaderRenderMode*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a Pack URI reference to HLSL bytecode in the assembly.
The <xref:System.Uri> is a Pack URI reference to a file inside the assembly.
The Pack URI reference to HLSL bytecode in the assembly.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Effects.PixelShader.UriSource*> dependency property.
To be added.
